tuv.seg: "Graph processing" is one of many areas of big data research that make you feel like we've gone backwards in time.
在大数据研究的众多领域中，"图处理" 是其中一个让你感觉好像我们返回旧时光的方向。
## Goals for 2016
## Progress in graph processing
## 图形处理进展
### Graph problems not graph algorithms.
### 图问题不同于图算法。
### Think like a computer scientist not a vertex
### 像计算机科学家一样思考而非一个顶点
#### Community detection
#### 社区发现
#### Differential dataflow
#### 微分数据流
#### Graph coloring
#### 图的着色
#### Label propagation
#### 标签传播
* Data analysis/data mining * Data warehousing * Online transaction processing * Virtualized infrastructure * Graph analytics * VDI
* 数据分析/数据挖掘 * 数据仓储 * 联机事务处理 * 虚拟化基础设施 * 图分析 * VDI
**Recommendation 1**: Authors of graph processing systems should be obliged to evaluate their implementations against other algorithms for the same problems.
** 建议 1 **: 图处理系统的作者们应该有义务将其系统与解决同样的问题的其他算法相比较。

... a supervised learning technique that has been used in the closely related context of document classication, where it has been shown to have lower complexity and higher robustness than other learning methods.
......一种监督的学习技术，被用于密切相关上下文的文档分类，并比其他的学习方法显示出较低的复杂度和更高的鲁棒性。
A decade ago, RAID vendors were having the same discussion when they were talking about front-end bandwidth (server to cache) vs. back-end bandwidth (cache to disk).
十年前，RAID 供应商有过相同的讨论，关于前端带宽 （服务器到缓存） 与后端带宽 （缓存到磁盘）。
A graph coloring is an assignment of colors (think small integers) to graph nodes so that no edge references two nodes of the same color.
图的着色是给图节点上色（可理解为小整数），同时保证没有一条边连接相同颜色的两个节点。
All good, right?
挺不错，是吧?

All graph processing systems can implement these algorithms, so in order to "have a fair comparison", a requirement of getting most papers published, you have to restrict your attention to this sort of problem.
所有的图处理系统均可以实现这些算法，因此，为"有一个公平的比较"，作为多数论文发表的条件，你必须将注意力局限到这类问题。

All of these connectivity options are limited by PCIe bandwidth, and though that might change in the future, the issues will be the same: How much bandwidth is needed between the host server(s) and the storage system(s).
所有这些连接选项都要受到 PCIe 带宽限制，虽然这在未来会有改变，问题仍将相同︰ 主机服务器和存储系统之间需要多少带宽。

An interesting question for the future from the paper is “... whether storage capacity growth will fall behind data-growth rates, meaning that the standard model of storing all data forever will no longer be sustainable because of a shortage of available storage resources.” The chances of that are, in my estimation, close to certain.
这篇论文向未来提出一个有趣的问题 "... 存储容量增长是否将落后于数据增长率，这意味着，由于可用存储资源的短缺，这种永远存储所有数据的标准模型将不可持续。" 其可能性是，据我估计，近乎必然。

Are these algorithms actually "representative graph problems", like the papers claim, and should we continue to improve the performance of these algorithms, assuming good general graph processing will come out of this work?
这些算法是否确实如同这些论文所述 "代表图问题"，而且我们是否应该继续提高这些算法的性能，并认为一般性图处理可以由此改善？
As 2015 draws to a close, the research published at top venues still targets pretty much pagerank, connected components via label propagation, and breadth-first distance labeling.
随着 2015 年临近尾声，发表在顶级会议上的研究仍然相当多的聚焦于 pagerank，基于标签传播的联通子图，和广度优先距离标签。
As a fun exercise, perhaps you could write down what you think would constitute progress?
作个有趣的作业，也许你可以写下那些你认为可以促成进步的内容？
As devices get faster and faster, channel performance must keep up.
随着设备越来越快、通道性能必须跟上。
As disk drives and solid state drives (SSDs) get faster and faster, I think it is time we stop and look at what really matters, namely, how much work gets done, not how fast a device is.
随着磁盘驱动器和固态硬盘 (SSD) 越来越快，我认为现在是时候停下脚步审视一下什么才是真正重要的方面，换句话说，能完成多少工作，而非设备如何快。
As the system watches human interaction with the data set, it learns what is important and tiers, protects and stores data according to user needs.
随着系统观察人与数据集的交互，它学会如何判断重要性并根据用户需要来分层、保护和存储数据。
As the training set got larger, the accuracy for the smaller classes improved, reaching nearly 100 percent accuracy at around 30 percent of the training data included.
随着训练集变得更大，较小分类精度持续提高，在训练数据的 30%左右可以达到近 100%的准确率。

At CIDR 2013, the [GRACE graph processing system](http://wenleix.github.io/paper/grace_cidr2013.pdf), no relation to [the other Grace graph processing system](https://www.usenix.org/system/files/conference/atc12/atc12-final182.pdf), presented a way to relax synchrony requirements in programs that otherwise look like bulk synchronous processors.

在 CIDR 2013 上, [GRACE 图处理系统](http://wenleix.github.io/paper/grace_cidr2013.pdf), 与 [另外一个 Grace 图处理系统](https://www.usenix.org/system/files/conference/atc12/atc12-final182.pdf) 无关，提出一种方法来缓解同步需求，有别于成批同步处理模式 (bulk synchronous processors)。

Authors should go and check out the [GAP benchmark suite](https://github.com/sbeamer/gapbs), which targets simpler problems like those above, but provides optimized implementations using algorithms you probably haven't ever heard of.
作者应该去查阅 [GAP benchmark suite] (https://github.com/sbeamer/gapbs)，其不仅以上面的那些简单问题为目标，更提供你可能还没听说过的优化算法。
Because the benchmark only requires the result, not a specific implementation, research and progress happened.
由于这项基准测试只需要结果，不考察特定实现、研究乃至相应进展。
Being a crap algorithm isn't the worst thing.
作为一种没用算法还不是最糟糕的事情。
But NVM is not a perfect replacement for DRAM, even ignoring latency.
然而 NVM 并非 DRAM 的理想替换品，就算不考虑延迟。
But Xpoint DIMMS are coming soon, and neither will give you anything close to 1,000x performance boost.
不过 Xpoint DIMMS 也快到来，而且没有哪个可以向你提供近 1,000 倍性能提升。
But even with new tools, such as graph databases, making sense of massive amounts of raw data is getting harder every day.
然而即便是用上新工具，比方说图数据库，去处海量原始数据的难度依然与日俱增。
By fixating only on the easiest of problems, researchers spiral into over-optimized and under-capable systems.
由于仅聚焦于这类最简化问题，研究者们一直在过于优化与能力不足系统之间转圈。

Commoditizing novel implementations of NVM – such as the hybrid memories this paper examines – will be a longer and more fraught process, but essential if we are to improve the efficiency and performance of all kinds of computer systems.
将 NVM 的新颖实现商品化 – 比如说文中分析的混合存储 – 将会是一项长期且艰巨的任务，不过若我们希望改善各种计算机系统的效率与性能，那也非常关键。
Connectivity to Storage Systems The options for connectivity to the storage systems today are SAS, Infiniband, Fibre Channel and NVMe.
存储系统连接 现在用于连接存储系统的选项有 SAS、Infiniband、光纤通道和 NVMe。
Courteous comments welcome, of course.
欢迎讨论，当然。
Device Connectivity
设备的连接
Establishing human trust in machine intelligence is a major domain problem – see Will Smith’s character in I, Robot.
建立人类对机器智能的信任是一个主要的领域问题 — — 看看在《我，机器人》里面威尔 · 史密斯的角色。
Even for disk drives, the SAS layout on the storage controller can have one SAS lane saturated by four disk drives.
甚至对于磁盘驱动器而言，存储控制器上的 SAS 布局中，四个磁盘驱动器就足以让一个 SAS 通道饱和。
Except each storage medium has its issues and NVM is no exception.
只不过每一种存储媒介都有它的问题，NVM 也不例外。

Existing file systems built for spinning or solid-state disks introduce software overheads that would obscure the performance that NVMs should provide, but proposed file systems for NVMs either incur similar overheads or fail to provide the strong consistency guarantees that applications require.
现有用于旋转磁盘或固态盘的文件系统所带来的软件开销将会削弱 NVM 原本应该提供的性能，然而现在为 NVM 设计的文件系统要么也有相似的开销，要么无法提供应用需要的强一致性保证。
Experimental results
实验结果

Experimental results show that in write-intensive workloads, NOVA provides 22% to 216× throughput improvement compared to state-of-the-art file systems, and 3.1× to 13.5× improvement compared to file systems that provide equally strong data consistency guarantees.
实验结果展示出就写密集负载而言，NOVA 可以提供比现有文件系统高出 22% 直至 216 倍的性能提升，而且即便与提供相同强一致性保障的文件系统相比，性能也有 3.1 倍到 13.5 倍的提升。
Fallibility will always be part of an AI’s nature.
易错性总会是人工智能本质的一部分。
Faster storage requires re-engineering the back-end storage system to ensure that there is enough bandwidth so each storage device can run at full rate.
更快的存储需要重新设计的后端存储系统以确保提供足够的带宽，使每个存储设备可以全速运转。
For IBM, a world leader in AI, as their success with Watson has demonstrated, applying intelligence to the problem of storage is a natural application.
就 IBM 而言，作为人工智能 (AI) 的领导者，基于在 Watson 上所展现出来的成功，将智能性应用在存储问题上是自然之选。
For an alternate approach, consider the [graph500 benchmark](http://www.graph500.org), originally conceived as a way to evaluate memory subsystems.
作为另一种方法，请考虑 [graph500 基准] (http://www.graph500.org)，最初被视为一种内存子系统评价方法。
For an interesting overview of the Gödel Machine, deep learning, and how a program can rewrite itself while running, Schmidhuber’s lecture is an excellent introduction.
Schmidhuber 的讲座为哥德尔机、深度学习，以及程序如何在运行时重写自身提供了一个不错的有趣介绍。
For those coming in late, the upcoming NVM technologies, of which Xpoint is only one, promise faster writes, higher endurance, and greater longevity than the NAND flash used in today’s SSDs.
如果原来不是很清楚，发展中的 NVM 技术里，Xpoint 只是其中之一，具备更快的写操作，更高的耐久性，以及比现在固态盘中使用的 NAND flash 更高的使用寿命。
From Jian’s abstract: ... managing, accessing, and maintaining consistency for data stored in NVM raises a host of challenges.
在 Jian 的摘要中: ... 管理，访问，和维护保存在 NVM 中数据的一致性引出不少挑战。
From the abstract of the paper A Family of Gödel Machine Implementations by Bas R. Steunebrink and Jürgen Schmidhuber of the IDSIA & University of Lugano:
这篇论文《一类哥德尔机的实现》(A Family of Gödel Machine Implementations) 由来分别来自于 IDSIA 和 Lugano 大学的 Bas R. Steunebrink 和 Jürgen Schmidhuber 完成，其摘要里说：
Gödel Machines, deep learning and the limits of AI by ROBIN HARRIS on WEDNESDAY, 13 JANUARY, 2016 If, like me, you’re interested in AI and deep learning, you’ll like this.
哥德尔机器、深度学习和人工智能的极限 罗宾 · 哈里斯 星期三 2016 年 1 月 13 日 如果像我一样，你对人工智能(AI)和深度学习(Deep Learning)有兴趣，你会喜欢这贴。
Gödel machines run on von Neumann architectures – they are not a new computer architecture.
哥德尔机可以在冯 · 诺依曼体系结构上运行 — — 他们不是一个新的计算机体系结构。
Here are my thoughts on why the area isn't making very much progress, and is in some cases regressing, as well as a few proposals for making thing better.
这里我谈一些我的想法，为什么这个区域没有实现什么进展，并且在某些情况下还有所退步，以及提几个改进建议。
Host Side
主机端

However, in my mind the most interesting thing to happen with graph500 was [Scott Beamer](http://www.cs.berkeley.edu/~sbeamer/research.html) and friends observing that a tweaked algorithm could traverse fewer edges, accomplishing the same result but moving less data over the memory subsystem.
然而，在我的印象中发生在 graph500 上最有趣的事情莫过于 [Scott Beamer] (http://www.cs.berkeley.edu/~sbeamer/research.html)，据朋友们观察，一项调整的算法可以通过遍历更少的边以实现相同的结果，从而在内存子系统移动较少的数据。
IB, essentially, relates the information’s metadata values to cognitive system relevance values with the goal of preserving the mutual information between the two.
IB，本质上，为信息的元数据价值，与认知系统相关值建立关联，目的是保持两者之间的互信息。
IBM researchers are proposing – and demoing – an intelligent storage system that works something like your brain.
IBM 提出 – 和展示 – 一款可以如大脑一般运作的智能存储系统.
IBM’s Watson runs on a massively parallel system, and I assume a Gödel Machine can too.
IBM 的沃森(Watson)运行在大规模并行系统上，我认为哥德尔机也可以。

If your storage systems are due a refresh and you are planning future purchases, then there's a huge elephant in the room that needs addressing: Intel and Micron's high performance 3D XPoint technology.
如果你的存储系统需要更新而且你正在计划未来的采购，那现在这里就有一个重磅消息值得关注︰ 英特尔和镁光的高性能 3D XPoint 技术。

If you’re processing IoT data sets, the storage system’s AI would have processed what is important about prior data sets and apply those criteria – access frequency, protection level, divergence from norms, time value, – to the incoming data.
如果您正在处理物联网数据集, 存储系统 AI 将在处理之前的数据集时分析出其重要性并且将有关特性 — — 访问频率、保护级别、偏离度、时间价值 — — 应用于未来的数据。
In Cognitive Storage for Big Data (paywall), IBM researchers Giovanni Cherubini, Jens Jelitto, and Vinodh Venkatesan, of IBM Research—Zurich, described their prototype system.
在《认知存储大数据》 （付费）上，来自 IBM 苏黎世研究所的研究人员 Giovanni Cherubini, Jens Jelitto 和 Vinodh Venkatesan，描述了其原型系统。

In a recent paper, NOVA: A Log-structured File System for Hybrid Volatile/Non-volatile Main Memories Jian Xu and Steven Swanson of the University of California, San Diego, discuss NVM integration issues.
在最近一篇论文，NOVA: A Log-structured File System for Hybrid Volatile/Non-volatile Main Memories 中，来自加州大学圣迭戈分校的 Jian Xu 与 Steven Swanson 探讨了 NVM 集成问题。
In particular, it maintains separate logs for each inode to improve concurrency, and stores file data outside the log to minimize log size and reduce garbage collection costs.
特别的，它还为每一个 inode 分别维护日志以提高并行性，而且将文件数据保存在日志之外来最小化日志尺寸，减少垃圾回收代价。
Integrating 3D Xpoint with DRAM by Robin Harris on Monday, 21 March, 2016 Intel is promising availability of 3D Xpoint non-volatile memory (NVM) this year, at least in their Optane SSDs.
将 3D Xpoint 与 DRAM 整合 作者 Robin Harris 于 星期一, 2016 年 3 月 21 日 Intel 承诺将于今年发售 3D Xpoint 非易失存储器 (NVM), 至少在他们的 Optane 固态盘中.
Integrating 3D Xpoint with DRAM by Robin Harris on Monday, 21 March, 2016 Intel is promising availability of 3D Xpoint non-volatile memory (NVM) this year, at least in their Optane SSDs.
将 3D Xpoint 与 DRAM 整合 作者 Robin Harris 于 星期一，2016 年 3 月 21 日 Intel 承诺将于今年发售 3D Xpoint 非易失存储器 (NVM)，至少在他们的 Optane 固态盘中。
Is this going to work at enterprise scale or will it be a purely web-scale service?
是否在在企业规模适用或它将成为一个纯粹的互联网尺寸服务？
It made a lot of sense for the authors, because they could compute what they needed and be done with it.
就作者而言这还是挺有意义，因为他们可以完成他们需要的计算。
It’s based on the idea that it’s easier to remember important, like a sunset over the Grand Canyon, than the last time you waited for a traffic light.
其基于这样一个想法，就是越重要的事情越容易记住，比方说在大峡谷上的日落，之于上一次等红灯。
I’m also pleased – probably unjustifiably – by the notion that however smart Ais become, they won’t be perfect.
这观点让我开心 – 虽然有些不太合适 – 无论人工智能将变得如何聪明，其仍无法完美。
I’m curious about the system architecture running the Gödel Machine and the I/O workload the machine generates.
我很好奇哥德尔机运行的系统体系结构及其生成的 I/O 工作负载。
Just as any software problem can be solved by adding a layer of indirection, any analytics problem can be solved by adding a layer of intelligence.
如同任何软件问题都可以通过增加一个间接层来解决一样，任何一项分析问题也可以通过补充一个智能层来处理。
Let's be clear, all the research to be published in 2016 has already been done and written by this point.
我们应该清楚，所有要在 2016 年发表的研究成果必须已经完成，而且已经写好。
Let's talk about that now.
我们现在谈谈这个问题。
Let’s start at the device and work our way up the stack.
让我们从设备一侧开始，工作我们沿着堆栈向上进行分析。
Modern CPU and memory systems may reorder stores to memory to improve performance, breaking consistency in case of system failure.
当代 CPU 与主存系统常将重组数据存储于主存以改善性能，系统出现故障时一致性将被破坏。
More importantly, I expect that several NVM types will be coming to market over the next 5 years.
更为重要的是，我期待着在未来5年里有几种类型的 NVM 能够进入市场。
Most controllers were designed with significantly more front-end bandwidth with the assumption that much of the data accessed would reside in cache.
大多数的控制器在设计上给前端带宽很大的余量，这是基于大部分数据访问将集中在缓存中的假设。
NOVA adapts conventional log-structured file system techniques to exploit the fast random access that NVMs provide.
NOVA 采用常规的日志文件系统技术，以发挥 NVM 提供的高速随机访问优势。
Neural networks are all the rage in AI, but there is a newer technology – Gödel machines – that is now a standard part of the AI toolset.
神经网络在人工智能领域正广受关注，然而还有新技术 — — 哥德尔机 — — 现在也成为 AI 工具集的一个标准部分。
No.
不。
Nonetheless, the IBM team is doing important work.
然而，IBM 团队正做着做重要的工作。
Now we get to the hard part of the equation.
现在我们来到这个问题中困难的部分。
Of course, we know a lot more about indirection than we do intelligence.
无疑，相比于智能，我们更理解间接。
Photo courtesy of Shutterstock.
照片由 Shutterstock 提供。
Placing a much-faster-than-flash-but-slower-and-cheaper-than-DRAM NVM on the processor's memory bus makes perfect sense.
将显著快过闪存且稍慢、稍便宜于 DRAM 的 NVM 放置在处理器的主存总线上更有意义。
Posted April 21, 2016 By Paul Rubens http://www.enterprisestorageforum.com/storage-technology/does-3d-xpoint-spell-the-end-for-flash-storage-1.html
发布 2016 年 4 月 21 日 由 Paul Rubens http://www.enterprisestorageforum.com/storage-technology/does-3d-xpoint-spell-the-end-for-flash-storage-1.html
Posted March 17, 2016 By Henry Newman http://www.enterprisestorageforum.com/storage-hardware/why-workloads-matter-more-than-iops-or-streaming.html
发布于 2016 年 3 月 17 日 由亨利 · 纽曼 http://www.enterprisestorageforum.com/storage-hardware/why-workloads-matter-more-than-iops-or-streaming.html

Presumably the original assumption was that folks would use breadth-first graph traversal, which exercised the memory subsystem in the way the benchmark authors intended (a mix of bulk memory access and pointer chasing).
是初的假设大概是，人们会使用广度优先遍历图，由此内存子系统访问将按照基准测试作者的意图 （大块内存访问和指针追逐的混合） 的方式进行。
Providing strong consistency guarantees is particularly challenging for memory-based file systems because maintaining data consistency in NVMM can be costly.
提供强一致性保证就基于内存的文件系统而言颇具挑战性，因为在 NVMM 中维护数据一致性代价不菲。
Rather, they are representative of algorithms that can be expressed in the lowest-common-denominator systems.
相反，他们是代表着最低共性特征的算法。
Remember label propagation for connected components?
还记得联通子图所用的标签传播吗？
Searcher.
搜索者。
So enabling machine intelligence to trash data is probably the most essential issue and value of cognitive storage – and the capability most likely to frighten users.
启用机器智能来舍弃数据可能是认知存储最基本的问题和价值所在 — — 也是最有可能让用户害怕的能力。
So many papers confuse graph "problems" and graph "algorithms".
很多论文混淆图"问题"和图"算法"。
So what does impact workload throughput for storage systems?
所以是什么在影响存储系统的工作负载吞吐量？
Solver.
求解器。
Some are forecasting that we’ll be generating more data than we’ll have capacity to store once IoT gets rolling.
已有预测指出，一旦物联网广泛运用，我们产生的数据将超过我们所拥有的存储容量.
Sounds workable!
听起来可行！
Storage costs continue to fall faster than computational costs, creating a difficult economic dynamic for cognitive storage.
相比计算成本，存储成本持续下降更快，也因此给认知存储造成一种困难的经济环境。

Sure, you can schlep unlikely-to-be-needed data off to low cost tape – IBM is a leading tape drive vendor – but the “store everything forever” algorithm doesn’t scale – and if something won’t scale forever, it won’t.
当然，你能将不太可能被用到的数据转移进低成本磁带上— — IBM 是领先的磁带驱动器供应商 — — 但"永远存储一切"算法无法扩展 — — 只要有什么不能持续扩展，那就不会。
That is my view of the main issue with graph processing research at the moment, but it shows up a few different ways.
这是我认为此刻在图处理研究中存在的主要问题，也揭示出一些不同的途径。

That, in a nutshell, is why systems won’t be able to advantage of NVM technology until their DRAM and disk I/O stacks are re-engineered for the specific advantages and quirks of NVM. The paper offers a smart way to adapt existing techniques to the brave new world of NVM. From the paper: ...
那么，归纳起来，这也就是为什么除非将 DRAM 与磁盘 I/O 栈针对 NVM 的特殊优势与问题进行重新设计，系统将不可能发挥出 NVM 技术的先进性。这篇论文提供了一种聪明的方法来将现有技术适配到 NVM 的全新领域中。 文中还提到: ...

这就是为何数据科学家面临急需。

The *problem* of undirected graph connectivity is to identify connected components, whereas the *algorithm* of label propagation is a specific approach based on repeatedly circulating the smallest known node identifiers.
无向图联通性 *问题* 是为找出联通子图，在这里这种标签传播 *算法* 是一种基于反复散布最小已知节点标记的特殊方法。

The Gödel Machine is a universal problem solver encoded as a completely self-referential program capable of rewriting any part of itself, provided it can prove that the rewrite is useful according to some utility function, encoded within itself.
哥德尔机是一种通用问题求解器，其被编码为完全自引用程序，能够改写自身任一部分，通过一些实用函数，在其内进行自编码，可以证明重写用途。
The Gödel Machine was invented by Jürgen Schmidhuber in 2003.
哥德尔机由 Jürgen Schmidhuber 在 2003 年发明。
The NVMW is a production of UCSD’s Non-Volatile Research Lab and the Center for Memory Recording Research.
非易失存储器研讨会 NVMW 是由加州大学圣迭戈分校 UCSD 的非易失研究实验室与存储记录研究中心主办的。
The StorageMojo take
StorageMojo 评论
The StorageMojo take The full paper is a must-read for anyone professionally concerned with integrating new NVM technologies into systems.
StorageMojo 评述 这篇论文对那些将 NVM 技术向系统进行整合有专业性考虑的人士而言是必读之作。
The StorageMojo take This is StorageMojo, not AIMojo.
StorageMojo 体会 这里是 StorageMojo，不是 AIMojo。
The answer is no, of course, and the same applies for CPU performance.
答案是不，当然，这同样适用于 CPU 的性能。
The benchmark requires one to compute the breadth-first distances and labels for a class of random graphs, and report the elapsed time.
这项基准测试需要在随机图上计算广度优先遍历的距离和标签，然后报告所用时间。

The class of graph algorithms modern systems typically express is quite limited, and as [we've seen before](https://github.com/frankmcsherry/blog/blob/master/posts/2015-01-15.md), many modern graph processors don't outperform a laptop on their intended computations.
现代系统通常表达的这类图论算法实际上有相当局限性 [我们以前见过] (https://github.com/frankmcsherry/blog/blob/master/posts/2015-01-15.md)，在其专属计算任务上，许多现代图形处理器甚至还不比笔记本电脑更强。
The connectivity to the storage system must take into account both the workflow and how that workflow impacts the underlying design of the storage system.
连接到存储系统时，必须考虑工作流，以及这个工作流会如何影响其下存储系统的设计。
The event attracts researchers from all over the world to present their work and make academic and commercial connections.
这个会议吸引了来自全世界的研究人员介绍他们的成果，建立起学术界与商业界之间的联系。
The greater the mutual information, the more valuable the data and, hence, the higher the level of protection, access, and so on.
互信息越大，就意味着数据更有价值，因此，就需要越高的保护级别，访问控制，等等。
The hyperscale guys have the incentive and the resources to perform deep analysis on new technologies.
那些高杆们具备动机与资源来深入分析新技术。

前者的引申含义是，因为至少一个改进不能通过搜索者证明，人工智能将仍然弱于最优。

在没用算法成为研究领域计算性能评估的基准时，这就成为了问题。

其关键在于使用机器学习来确定数据价值。

人工智能的极限 正如哥德尔(Gödel)所证明的，任何形式系统，包括算术，或者包含无法证明的永真命题，或者不完备。

在今年的海量存储系统和技术会议 （MSST）主要主题中，工作流的重要性将盖过带宽或 IOPs。

问题是，是否更快的存储系统总是意味着更快的工作负载吞吐量。

在图处理系统方向上的研究仍 （就我的阅读而言） 主要集中在以这些问题作为其核心的评价指标，也因此主要是为了提高他们在这些问题上的表现。

研究人员使用了一项被称作“信息瓶颈 (Information Bottleneck, IB)”的学习算法

搜索者旨在从整体上以可证明最优的方式改善哥德尔机 — — 针对哥德尔受到的可证明性限制。
